column3: The point is that these coins were pulled into the cache by ATMPW, but we don't want them there, so they're actively removed afterwards.

The idea is that we uncache the inputs that were added to pcoinsTip during validation of the rejected transaction.  Otherwise, someone could send us junk transactions that waste our cache memory, harming performance.

Ah, my bad - thanks for the pointers!

I had trouble finding where the outpoints were actually being added to `pcoinsTip`; it turns out the addition is buried in a call to `view.HaveCoin()` -> [`view.FetchCoin()`](https://github.com/jamesob/bitcoin/blob/4b714b7c8bc1a7fa01cfd92c231e0aa3f8a85ffa/src/coins.cpp#L48), both of which are (somewhat confusingly) marked `const`.

I'll follow up with
